title: Trying to get gold the season? Try this!

embed.description: Highlights from season 7 ranked solo que. Hope you guys enjoy! Please like and subscribe! Summoner: perspectiv Region: NA This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License. https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/3.0/ -Music- FLiX - Hot Blooded https://soundcloud.com/flixmusik/flix-hot-blooded-1 Jayceeoh - Elevate (feat. Nevve) https://soundcloud.com/jayceeoh

body: Morg is a great pick to help you work your way towards gold. I started to main morg last season (s6) and have done pretty well with her in the silver/gold elos. What do you guys think?

replies.body:
MORG MID IS ALWAYS A GOOD THING.

Well...sometimes.

Usually.

Maybe.
Someone brought up earlier in the thread about DFT vs TL on Morg. Which one do you prefer?

> [{quoted}](name=perspectiv,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ijvUBmqr,comment-id=00050002,timestamp=2017-03-17T22:12:32.938+0000)
>
> Someone brought up earlier in the thread about DFT vs TL on Morg. Which one do you prefer?

I prefer Thunderlords atm, it's a lot easier to get sweet poke in with Ludens for that double W tick and Ludens to proc it.

DFT may be ideal against a super tank heavy team though, but sometimes Liandry is enough for that.

> [{quoted}](name=Morgageddon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ijvUBmqr,comment-id=000500020001,timestamp=2017-03-18T01:00:29.999+0000)
>
> I prefer Thunderlords atm, it's a lot easier to get sweet poke in with Ludens for that double W tick and Ludens to proc it.
> 
> DFT may be ideal against a super tank heavy team though, but sometimes Liandry is enough for that.

I once tried combining Liandries with DFT, did disgusting damage 
on a side note, my Q had a total of over 1000 damage with full build+elixir before resistances

DFT, {{item:3151}} , {{item:3116}} .

Soil hurts even without landing Q.
Stoneborn is clearly the best. Land one Q and your team can heal for the rest of the game.
Looks like my team won't be healing then.
Name and rank check out.
Is there any major difference between playing her mid vs. support?

I usually play her the same way main difference is your gold income you get the same items, but now you're getting them faster in mid so the enemy feels the power of that q earlier on. Haven't played this game for as long but morg was one of the original champions i started playing, kinda surprised morg mid wasn't really nerfed that much to be shoved down as a support.

ALWAYS!!!!!

Wow your Morg stats are amazing. Great to see her doing well in high elos.

Video is decent, but you can use anyone to climb to Gold if you're good enough. Morg works well because people at low elo don't bother trying to dodge skillshots, so it makes her very simple: Press Q, W, auto... win? It's kind of like Garen and how just presses Q -> E, except he doesn't even have to aim. While I definitely consider Garen to be a "brainless" champ, Morgana is among the easier ones (not entirely brainless, though).

What really sets good Morg players apart from great ones is their use of E and R. When used at the right time--and without feeding--she can feel really hard to deal with.

I agree with mostly all that you said and if you're good enough any champ can get you to gold. But I think good morg players are ones who can land Q's consistently and play more of a "support" mid role for the team. That bind is just so good for harassing/picking people off. 

Thanks for the feedback btw!

Hmm. Nice. Question, what do you typically do? I literately just tried this this morning (before seeing this. Weird. o.0), and I was running a more DoT build (DFT, {{item:3151}}, {{item:3116}}, etc), but you appear to be going a more traditional TLD mage route with {{item:3165}} as a first item. Have you experimented with DFT Morg at all? Do you have any comments on it?

Overall, nice video! Had me on the edge of my seat with some of those plays!

Thanks for the great comment.

The way I usually play morg mid is I go for max cdr via {{item:3165}} {{item:3157}} {{item:3158}} because at 40% cdr her Q cd = 6.6s and W cd = 6.0s which is really nice. Also reducing her summoner cool downs with {{item:3158}}  is a plus since she's often going to engage fights. 

I play a "support" mid morg trying to push waves and land lots of binds for harassing/picking off people. {{item:3151}} {{item:3116}} These items are definitely nice when I can afford to build them. In long games or if the enemy team is pretty tanky you really need {{item:3151}}  to do any damage.

edit: And I haven't really tried DFT with her actually. The TL proc from W is pretty nice.

Morg is a champ i used last season to climb to gold. Midlane and support i preferred to use {{item:3117}}  because it helps land Qs when you come speeding up. Either role you do not have to build a ton of damage to be relevant. 
She has a buttload of utility and can farm waves very safely with W and the spell vamp in her passive helps heal you for sustain. my favorite morg build was something like:
{{item:3117}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3157}}  {{item:3107}} {{item:3512}} 
But I think her core is Liandry's,Morellos,and zhonyas right now. Being just stocky enough to land and survive a teamfight where you can use your ult to its potential is game changing.
I do agree morg is a solid pick in low elo's because if you play her patiently and farm safely you will usually press an opponent into making a bad decision. Baiting them just under turret range and landing a q+ult+w will usually kill anyone and if youre being dove you can ult any number of people and hit zhinyas
Yea I havne't tried a build like that yet. I will try it. Thanks
You don't use mikaels?
I don't think it was called for in the game I was playing. mikaels on morg is very strong in a team fight combined with her shield.

Played couple PvP games, now.

I actually think I prefer DFT with her. It gives you _certain_ bonus damage on her W, instead of having to either land a Q first, or hoping that the enemy's just too dumb to walk out of it. i actually basically ran the same masteries I have for Satan, but I use vampirism and sorcery, instead of the other two.

I got a tip of maxing W first, and rushing {{item:3027}} to make up for the absurd mana costs (130/use at rank 5. ;w;) (mana regen quints helped a bit, too. :P). I then got {{item:3020}} for more mpen, _then_ {{item:3151}}. Even more tank-melting. :D

By this point, the enemy {{champion:238}}  couldn't even touch me, he was too scared. XD

I led that into {{item:3116}} so that I could melt entire waves with one W. The slow on it made it even more cruel. :D

By _this_ point, I had more health than both our {{champion:80}} and {{champion:412}}. It was a _bit_ absurd, having over 3k health. :P

{{item:3165}} was next, mostly for grievous wounds, and I was planning to finish with {{item:3089}}, but the enemy {{champion:420}}  was just too strong. ;w;
Ironically, our {{champion:103}} (toplane) _had_ won laning phase. The hentai community's heads would have popped.

9/10 game, would play again. Loved how I didn't even need to buy {{item:3157}} against {{champion:238}}.
I never build RoA because I care too much about CD hehe.
I tend to fall back to an old build and rush {{item:3027}}, then to {{item:3157}}. {{item:3151}} is usually third or Fourth

I've been maining her mostly since season 4 (Victorious Morg <3) and yeah she's still pretty great.  Started off last season with a Penta as her in the support role (with little AP too), so don't even have to be the carry to do some awesome work with her :D
Victorious Morg is best.
I see a lot more teamwork than I see in my games. :|

Probably just an effect of the video since in most clips I'm landing binds where my team can engage on. You've been gold for multiple seasons like me so I don't think our games should differ that much.
i generally hate all montages ... i can't tell if this is satire though
Well I hope you enjoyed it a little :D
I think it does jacks**t for me as a top lane main xD
Actually morg top is a thing... it actually works pretty well. Try it sometime :D

> [{quoted}](name=perspectiv,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ijvUBmqr,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2017-03-17T17:39:51.215+0000)
>
> Actually morg top is a thing... it actually works pretty well. Try it sometime :D

Will do, always open to new things

Play her like Karma top and build a ton of utility and she is a safe pick anywhere. You can almost always make it back to your tower because of your spell shield and if someone comes in for a gank you have the cc to lock them down.
^ Like he said.
Yea, the extra tankyness helps with teh ulti.

I can agree with morg being great in low elo, shes a safe pick because she can farm from safety, R is a good counter attack vs enemy all-ins/ganks, and in low elo people are so concerned w/ "team-deathmatch" that safe picks that can farm their butt off and not feed become really strong later into the game.
Looks like all the boxes are checked hehe. Yea I really think she's great in silver/gold elo.
I liked it. You are better than I am, but it made me want to play her more.

Definitely try her out mid since she has a really safe laning phase due to her E/Q and R lol.

Thanks for the comment!
What do you max first on her?
My skill order usually goes: W-->Q-->E-->W-->W then I max Q first. You want level 3 W to clear the back minion line.
Thanks! That really helps :)
I've mainly used her as support but been leaning towards tanks this season. Is she still viable as support? What are good/bad teams to play as her?
Some things just never change. If you eat a Morg Q, you're going to get f#*%ed
With the hitboxes on her Q terrible as always, might be worth looking at trying out.
u can get to gold doing anything lmao
